Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Trump signed an executive order in March 2018 granting veterans free health care at any hospital.
Understate: The claim understates the actual actions taken by President Trump, as he signed a bill to extend the Veterans Choice Act, which provided greater access to health care providers for veterans.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or documentation of President Trump signing an executive order in March 2018 granting veterans free health care at any hospital.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the Veterans Choice Act and an executive order granting free health care at any hospital are the same thing.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, which is that the claim is referring to the Veterans Choice Act signed by President Obama in 2014 and extended by President Trump in 2017, rather than an executive order in 2018.
